text: In this experiment, we compared seeds of wild-type L
at 2 weeks of dry storage (non-dormant), dormant

(non-dormant, 2 weeks of dry storage). For RNA extraction, 20 mg of dry seed per sample was sown on filter paper moistened with sterile 0.5× MS salts buffered with 5mM MES, pH 5.5.  Seeds were collected at two timepoints: 1) a 0h timepoint harvested immediately after cold stratification for 4 d at 4°C in the dark, and 2) a 12h timepoint incubated 12h in the light at 22°C following the 4 d cold stratification at 4°C.

protocol.text: RNA isolation was performed using a phenol-chloroform extraction developed for tough tissues such as Arabidopsis seeds based on Oñate-Sánchez and Vicente-Carbajosa (2008) with an additional chloroform extraction and the use of Phase Lock (5-PRIME) gel tubes to allow complete recovery of the aqueous phase without risk of organic phase contamination.

Data analysis of raw CEL files was performed using the LIMMA package as part of the Bioconductor suite of tools in the R statistical programming environment (Gentleman et al., 2004; Smyth, 2005; R Core Team, 2014).  Background correction and normalization was performed by Robust Multi-array Average (RMA), control probesets were removed, and significance was determined by False Discovery Rate (FDR) with α = 0.05 (Benjamini and Hochberg, 1995; Irizarry et al., 2003).

Amplification and labeling was performed using the Applause 3’-Amp System (p/n 5100-24) and the Encore Biotin Module (p/n 4200-12) from the company NuGEN.  Based on the manufacturer’s protocols, we started with 200 ng of total RNA for the 3’-amp kit and 3.75 µg of amplified cDNA (generated from the amp kit) was used as the input for the Biotin module.
The 3.75 µgs of cDNA was fragmented and biotinylated and that entire amount was hybridized to the GeneChip Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Array.
protocol.type: nucleic acid hybridization to array protocol

protocol.text: GeneChips were scanned according to Affymetrix protocols.
protocol.type: array scanning and feature extraction protocol
